name: Hello new meta-class!
description:
Part of meta-programming is creating classes dynamically.

In this task you need to create a module `Foo`, such that if you call any inner class of Foo that *doesn't exist*, Foo will create the inner class then return a friendly greeting `"Hello, <insert name here>!"`.

Example:

```ruby
> Foo::Bar          # the inner class `Bar` doesn't exist initially,
=> "Hello, Bar!"    # so create the class and return a greeting

> Foo::Bar
=> Foo::Bar         # the `Bar` inner class now exists, so return it

> Foo::Lemon
=> "Hello, Lemon!"
```

Hint: Classes in ruby are actually just constants. Ruby already comes with methods to check if there is a missing constant, and how to create a new constant.
